alert.note: Alert for West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 25 at 3:12AM PST until December 28 at 9:00AM PST by NWS Sacramento
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM TUESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 8 to 24 inches, locally up to 30 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 70 mph. * WHERE...Western Plumas County/Lassen Park and West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada Counties. * WHEN...From Tuesday afternoon through Wednesday morning. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Very strong winds could cause extensive tree damage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow levels will start out high but will be lowering Tuesday afternoon below major pass levels. Additional storm systems are expected throughout the week into next weekend.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: West Slope Northern Sierra Nevada; Western Plumas County, Lassen Park
